italic.text: To depollute or decontaminate in order to rehabilitate a site or a soil that has been polluted by industrial activities. The decontamination of a site reduces the risk of pollution to acceptable levels or make it disappear.

line.text: In SWORD, decontaminating a site ("contaminated site") by NBC unit prevents units from being contaminated. It prevents the creation and the dispersion of a contaminated cloud that can cause injuries in units. A "decontaminated site" in SWORD is defined by a surface delimited by a polygon. All contamination objects (such as "contaminated area") that intersect with the decontaminated surface lose their contamination capacity.

The agent put on his CBRN protection (the report "CBRN suit put on" should be displayed). The agent moves toward the area.if possible, the agent moves to the center, otherwise ("impossible to go through this" should be displayed) it moves to a close position (the position closest to the center).
The agent begins to decontaminate it, the report "starting to decontaminate" should be displayed. When the agent finish to decontaminate, the report "decontamination done" should be displayed.
The time to decontaminate an area is depening of the time to agent to be posted.
At the end of the decontamination, the agent stays at its own position and the mission ends.
